Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of wool and linen cloth. The motif is a cable wreath enclosing vine leaves in purple. The border is in red with red and green scallops on the outer edge.Technique: plain weave ground with thicker weft stripes. Motifs in tapestry weave over double and triple warp threads using very fine woollen yarns.Ends per inch (warp threads): 60.Picks per inch (weft threads): 40.
